prompt: Evaluate cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT) as an evidence-based treatment for depression and anxiety, considering mechanisms of change, efficacy, and limitations.

criteria.name: Mechanisms of Change
criteria.description: Demonstrates understanding of cognitive restructuring, behavioral activation, exposure, and skills training.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Explains mechanisms with clarity, showing how cognitive and behavioral techniques interact and referencing maintenance processes (avoidance, rumination).
performance_descriptors.good: Covers core mechanisms with minor gaps.
performance_descriptors.average: General description; limited integration of mechanisms.

criteria.name: Evidence and Efficacy
criteria.description: Evaluates research support and comparative effectiveness.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Accurately summarizes evidence from RCTs/meta-analyses, relapse prevention, and comparisons to medication and combined treatments.
performance_descriptors.good: Discusses evidence with some depth and nuance.
performance_descriptors.average: General claims of efficacy without detail.

criteria.name: Limitations and Adaptations
criteria.description: Addresses limitations, barriers, and cultural adaptations.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Considers access, adherence, cultural tailoring, therapist competence, and condition-specific limits; mentions third-wave approaches where relevant.
performance_descriptors.good: Notes several limitations with some solutions.

criteria.name: Clinical Application
criteria.description: Translates evidence into practical treatment planning.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Provides a coherent case formulation and stepwise intervention plan including measurement-based care.
performance_descriptors.good: Offers practical steps with moderate specificity.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Strong structure and precise language with smooth transitions.

key_points: Outline cognitive restructuring and behavioral activation with examples.
Summarize evidence for CBT vs. SSRIs and combined treatment.
Discuss relapse prevention and booster sessions.
Identify limitations (e.g., treatment-resistant cases) and cultural adaptations.
Describe outcome monitoring and case formulation steps.
